intro: Hylenaea praecelsa, commonly known as the tall hylenaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often followed by small, round fruits. Hylenaea praecelsa is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of the flora in its native habitat.
